001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.jsonrpc.service;
002
003import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Flowable;
004import io.reactivex.rxjava3.disposables.Disposable;
005import io.reactivex.rxjava3.processors.BehaviorProcessor;
006import io.reactivex.rxjava3.processors.FlowableProcessor;
007import org.bitcoinj.base.Sha256Hash;
008import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.ChainTip;
009import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.TxOutSetInfo;
010import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.ChainTipPublisher;
011import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.jsonrpc.RxBitcoinClient;
012import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.DefaultRpcClient;
013import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.AsyncSupport;
014import org.reactivestreams.Publisher;
015import org.slf4j.Logger;
016import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
017
018import java.io.Closeable;
019import java.io.IOError;
020import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
021import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
022import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger;
023
024/**
025 * Service to return a stream of TxOutSetInfos for a given blockchain/client.
026 * Updates are triggered on new blocks (via {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.ChainTipService} a cache
027 * is used to prevent fetches of TxOutSetInfos already fetched (e.g. on blockchain re-org) and
028 * {@code MAX_OUTSTANDING_CALLS} is used to prevent overloading the server (e.g. during blockchain sync)
029 */
030public class TxOutSetService implements Closeable {
031    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(TxOutSetService.class);
032    private final RxBitcoinClient client;
033    private final ChainTipPublisher chainTipPublisher;
034    private final FlowableProcessor<TxOutSetInfo> txOutSetProcessor = BehaviorProcessor.create();
035    private final int CACHE_BLOCK_DEPTH = 1;
036    private final int MAX_OUTSTANDING_CALLS = 2;
037    private final AtomicInteger outstandingCalls = new AtomicInteger(0);
038    // TODO: Combine lastCall with cache and with in-memory SPV blockchain
039    private CompletableFuture<TxOutSetInfo> lastCall;
040    private final ConcurrentHashMap<Sha256Hash, TxOutSetInfo> txOutSetCache = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
041    private volatile Disposable txOutSetSubscription;
042
043    // TODO: Use BitcoinClient not RxBitcoinClient
044    /**
045     * @param client Client for requesting {@link TxOutSetInfo} objects.
046     * @param chainTipPublisher Publisher telling us when new blocks are available.
047     */
048    public TxOutSetService(RxBitcoinClient client, ChainTipPublisher chainTipPublisher) {
049        this.client = client;
050        this.chainTipPublisher = chainTipPublisher;
051    }
052
053    private synchronized void start() {
054        if (txOutSetSubscription == null) {
055            txOutSetSubscription = Flowable.fromPublisher(chainTipPublisher)
056                    .doOnNext(this::onNewBlock)
057                    .flatMap(this::fetchCacheMaybe)
058                    .subscribe(txOutSetProcessor::onNext, txOutSetProcessor::onError, txOutSetProcessor::onComplete);
059        }
060    }
061
062    public Publisher<TxOutSetInfo> getTxOutSetPublisher() {
063        start();
064        return txOutSetProcessor;
065    }
066    
067    private void onNewBlock(ChainTip tip) {
068        // Remove all cache entries with txOutSetInfo.height < tip.height - CACHE_BLOCK_DEPTH;
069        log.info("TxOutSetCache: checking {} entries for entries more than {} blocks old", txOutSetCache.size(), CACHE_BLOCK_DEPTH);
070        txOutSetCache.values().removeIf(txOutSetInfo -> {
071            boolean remove = txOutSetInfo.getHeight() < (tip.getHeight() - CACHE_BLOCK_DEPTH);
072            if (remove) {
073                log.info("Removing TxOutSetInfo For {}/{}", txOutSetInfo.getHeight(), txOutSetInfo.getBestBlock());
074            }
075            return remove;
076        });
077    }
078
079    // TODO: Ignoring all IOError is too broad
080    final DefaultRpcClient.TransientErrorFilter errorFilter = AsyncSupport.TransientErrorFilter.of(
081            (t) -> t instanceof IOError,                        // Ignore if IOError
082            (t) -> log.warn("Ignoring transient error: ", t)    // Log if ignored
083    );
084
085    // TODO: Convert to using CompletableFuture to drop dependency on RxBitcoinClient and RxJava
086    /**
087     * Try to fetch a TxOutSetInfo from the cache or from the network. Returning an empty stream if a transient error occurs.
088     * To use this you will typically call {@link Flowable#flatMap(io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Function)}.
089     * @param tip ChainTip we are looking for
090     * @return An Observable that returns 0 or 1 (behaves as a Maybe) TxOutSetInfo
091     */
092    private Publisher<TxOutSetInfo> fetchCacheMaybe(ChainTip tip) {
093        return client.pollOnceAsPublisher(() -> fetchCache(tip), errorFilter);
094    }
095
096    // Try to fetch a TxOutSetInfo from the cache or from the network.
097    private CompletableFuture<TxOutSetInfo> fetchCache(ChainTip tip) {
098        TxOutSetInfo cached = txOutSetCache.get(tip.getHash());
099        if (cached != null) {
100            return CompletableFuture.completedFuture(cached);
101        } else {
102            return fetch(tip);
103        }
104    }
105
106    // Fetch a TxOutSetInfo or return last one if too many calls are outstanding
107    private CompletableFuture<TxOutSetInfo> fetch(ChainTip tip) {
108        if (outstandingCalls.intValue() >= MAX_OUTSTANDING_CALLS) {
109            // TODO: Use a synthesized totalCoins (e.g. lastValue + block_reward * delta_blocks)
110            log.info("Re-using last call because {} outstanding calls. ", MAX_OUTSTANDING_CALLS);
111        } else {
112            int calls = outstandingCalls.incrementAndGet();
113            log.info("Fetching TxOutSetInfo For {}/{} ({} outstanding calls)", tip.getHeight(), tip.getHash(), calls);
114            lastCall = client.supplyAsync(client::getTxOutSetInfo)
115                    .whenComplete(this::fetchCompletion);
116        }
117        return lastCall;
118    }
119
120    private void fetchCompletion(TxOutSetInfo info, Throwable t) {
121        int calls = outstandingCalls.decrementAndGet();
122        if (info != null) {
123            log.info("Completion result for: {}/{} ({} outstanding calls)", info.getHeight(), info.getBestBlock(), calls);
124            txOutSetCache.put(info.getBestBlock(), info);
125        } else {
126            log.info("Completion throwable: {} ({} outstanding calls)", t, calls);
127        }
128    }
129    
130    @Override
131    public void close()  {
132        if (txOutSetSubscription != null) {
133            txOutSetSubscription.dispose();
134        }
135    }
136}
